para: Sharpen an ℑ by enhancing the difference between it and a blurred version of itself, by calling skimage.filters.unsharp_mask.

radius is the standard deviation of the gaussian, in pixel units. If radius is too small, the algorithm may enhance noise in the image. amount is the factor by which the sharp features are enhanced. Large values may lead to cartoonish images.

If mode is RGB the sharpening is applied to each of the color channels independently. This can lead to odd color changes as seen in . Setting mode to HSV sharpens only the value channel in an HSV representation of the image, and does a better job of preserving color, as shown in .

caption.para: A small section of an Escher print, on the left, and the result of sharpening it with mode=RGB and the given values of radius and amount. The colors are badly distorted in the extreme cases.
A small section of an Escher print, on the left, and the result of sharpening it with mode=HSV and the given values of radius and amount. Colors are preserved better than they are when mode=RGB.
